Clark is an Assistant Professor in the Bioengineering Department at the University of California, Berkeley, and a faculty affiliate at the California Institute for Quantitative Biosciences. Research in the Clark lab combines tools from multiple disciplines - molecular biology, microfluidics, engineering, and bioinformatics - to study infectious diseases, central nervous system inflammation, and neural circuit connectivity.

events.details: Our upcoming seminar will focus on understanding the wet-lab and dry-lab aspects of this technique. Specifically, the participants will perform a mock experiment in the lab and they will learn how to analyze the data from the primary demultiplexing step through CellRanger and the subsequent quality control, clustering, annotation, differentially expressed genes analysis using Seurat package.
